description: You can call DescribeValidDBInstanceModifications to learn what modifications you can make to your DB instance. You can use this information when you call ModifyDBInstance. This command doesn't apply to RDS Custom.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The customer identifier or the ARN of your DB instance.

nested_items.name: ValidDBInstanceModificationsMessage
nested_items.description: Information about valid modifications that you can make to your DB instance. Contains the result of a successful call to the DescribeValidDBInstanceModifications action. You can use this information when you call ModifyDBInstance.

nested_items.name: Storage
nested_items.description: Valid storage options for your DB instance.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The valid storage types for your DB instance. For example: gp2, gp3, io1, io2.

nested_items.name: StorageSize
nested_items.description: The valid range of storage in gibibytes (GiB). For example, 100 to 16,384.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The minimum value in the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The maximum value in the range.

nested_items.name: Step
nested_items.description: The step value for the range. For example, if you have a range of 5,000 to 10,000, with a step value of 1,000, the valid values start at 5,000 and step up by 1,000. Even though 7,500 is within the range, it isn't a valid value for the range. The valid values are 5,000, 6,000, 7,000, 8,000--¦

nested_items.name: ProvisionedIops
nested_items.description: The valid range of provisioned IOPS. For example, 1000-256,000.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The minimum value in the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The maximum value in the range.

nested_items.name: Step
nested_items.description: The step value for the range. For example, if you have a range of 5,000 to 10,000, with a step value of 1,000, the valid values start at 5,000 and step up by 1,000. Even though 7,500 is within the range, it isn't a valid value for the range. The valid values are 5,000, 6,000, 7,000, 8,000--¦

nested_items.name: IopsToStorageRatio
nested_items.description: The valid range of Provisioned IOPS to gibibytes of storage multiplier. For example, 3-10, which means that provisioned IOPS can be between 3 and 10 times storage.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The minimum value in the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The maximum value in the range.

nested_items.name: SupportsStorageAutoscaling
nested_items.description: Indicates whether or not Amazon RDS can automatically scale storage for DB instances that use the new instance class.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedStorageThroughput
nested_items.description: The valid range of provisioned storage throughput. For example, 500-4,000 mebibytes per second (MiBps).

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The minimum value in the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The maximum value in the range.

nested_items.name: Step
nested_items.description: The step value for the range. For example, if you have a range of 5,000 to 10,000, with a step value of 1,000, the valid values start at 5,000 and step up by 1,000. Even though 7,500 is within the range, it isn't a valid value for the range. The valid values are 5,000, 6,000, 7,000, 8,000--¦

nested_items.name: StorageThroughputToIopsRatio
nested_items.description: The valid range of storage throughput to provisioned IOPS ratios. For example, 0-0.25.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The minimum value in the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The maximum value in the range.

nested_items.name: ValidProcessorFeatures
nested_items.description: Valid processor features for your DB instance.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the processor feature. Valid names are coreCount and threadsPerCore.

nested_items.name: DefaultValue
nested_items.description: The default value for the processor feature of the DB instance class.

nested_items.name: AllowedValues
nested_items.description: The allowed values for the processor feature of the DB instance class.

nested_items.name: SupportsDedicatedLogVolume
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports using a dedicated log volume (DLV).
